documents.content:
# California Type 41 Beer & Wine License (2026)

## Department of Alcoholic Beverage Control (ABC)

### What is a Type 41 License?
A Type 41 license allows restaurants to sell beer and wine for on-premises consumption with meals.

### Key Features
- **Beverages Allowed:** Beer and wine only (no spirits/liquor)
- **Food Requirement:** At least 50% of gross sales must be from food
- **Minors:** Allowed on premises
- **Off-Sale:** Beer and wine in manufacturer-sealed containers allowed
- **Hours:** Per local ordinance (typically 6 AM - 2 AM)

### Application Fees (2026 - includes 2.72% CPI increase)
| Fee Type | Amount |
|----------|--------|
| Application Fee | $400 - $650 |
| Fingerprinting | ~$60 |
| 30-Day Posting Fee | Included |

### Annual Fees by City Population (2026)
| City Population | Annual Fee |
|-----------------|------------|
| Over 40,000 | $565 |
| 20,000 - 40,000 | $502 |
| Under 20,000 | $447 |

### Processing Timeline
- **Original Application:** ~60-90 days
- **30-Day Posting Period:** Required (neighbors can protest)
- **Local Government Review:** Varies by city

### Transfer Fees (Person-to-Person)
- Transfer Application: $420
- Processing time: ~75 days

### Advantages Over Type 47
- Significantly lower fees
- Faster approval process
- No quota limitations
- Easier for new restaurants

### Official URLs
- ABC Main: https://www.abc.ca.gov
- License Types: https://www.abc.ca.gov/licensing/license-types/
- Fee Schedule: https://www.abc.ca.gov/licensing/license-fees/
